title: By the Water Front
text: This place was by the waterfront where there is a statue and a small Chapel nearby. Great place to take a stroll and people watch.

title: The Shopping Street
text: This is a long stretch of street and where you can find lots of cafes, restaurants, souvenir shops. A must visit when in town.

title: Infested by Iguanas
text: This is a pretty beautiful site as it is located by the sea. Other than the ruins, the key attractions are the blue waters as well as the many iguanas onsite. This was a very popular site and hence very touristy but pretty nice place to stroll around.

title: Close Encounter with the Sharks
text: This was an excellent place for snorkeling as the sharks are really close by. There were also lots of other marine life.

title: Beautiful but very Touristy
text: This is a beautiful island and is a definite must visit when in Belize which was probably why it was so touristy.

title: Lovely Place
text: Stayed here for a couple of nights and loved walking along the beach. From here, you can take a flight over the blue hole, go boating, swimming and snorkeling or simply just relax and enjoy the some fresh seafood.

title: Not too difficult to hike
text: This was just one of the cascading pools in the park and a great place to take a dip and have a bit of thrill while at it.

title: Amazing Mayan Ruins
text: Enjoyed the visit to this Mayan site which was somewhat different from Chichen Itza. There's more opportunities to climb up the ruins here. Also saw some howler monkeys up in the trees. Best to visit early in the morning to avoid the crowd and the heat.

title: A Must Visit
text: Visited this site from Cancun which was approx. 3 hours' drive away. This is definitely one of the key sites in the country and a must visit. Learnt a lot about the past civilization as well as the kind of games they used to play. Was pretty crowded and hot. Needed a hat to shield from the strong sun.

title: Where the Sound of Music Wedding was Held
text: Came here as part of the Sound of Music tour. This is a pretty small church and not as elaborate as Salzburg Cathedral but is the film location of the movie where the wedding was held.

title: Just for a quick photo stop
text: This sculpture by Salzburg painter and sculptor Max Rieder is near Mirabell Palace and consisted of 2 girls on the left and right and 1 boy in the middle, each holding a different musical instrument. Just for a quick photo stop.

title: War Memorial
text: This is a war memorial to commemorate the fallen during the 1st and 2nd World War. Passed by this quaint town on the way to and back from Hallstatt.

title: Watch out for these
text: When in Salzburg or any of the German cities, its good to keep a lookout for these little memorials of the actual victims of the Nazis. It has the date when they are captured as well.

title: Sound of Music
text: Came here as part of the Sound of Visit tour. A quaint place. Loved the reflections of the buildings on the water. Best to visit early in the morning.

title: Just for a Quick Photo
text: Unfortunately, the horse statue though still visable was covered up during winter but the paintings can still be seen clearly. Just for a quick photo stop.

title: Shopping Street
text: This is the main Shopping street within the older part of Salzburg, with lots of shops. Good place for window shopping.

title: Good to Visit
text: There were quite a number of stalls in this square selling food and also some souvenirs. Worth taking a look.

title: For Fans of Mozart
text: Loved this little yellow building worth visiting especially if you are a fan of Mozart. Not a big museum and hence shouldn't take more than 30 mins.

title: Nice Station
text: This Station pretty big and has services to other parts of Europe as well. Trains were on time and there are shops and supermarket in the station as well.

title: Nice Collection
text: This museum is worth visiting when in Salzburg as it has a pretty good collection of art pieces and exhibits. Free entrance with Salzburg card.

title: Beautiful little cemetary
text: This is one of the oldest cemetery in Salzburg and though small, was beautiful and really peaceful and quiet. Definitely worth visiting.

title: Stunning!
text: This is located within the Old town and near to major attractions. It has beautiful architecture both inside as well as outside. Loved all the paintings in the cathedral. A definite must see in Salzburg.

title: A Must Visit
text: This is a must visit when in Salzburg. You can choose to either climb up or take a tram up. I chose to take a tram up and go by foot on the way down. This was a very well preserved and big fortress and has spectacular panorama views over Salzburg as well as the alps. Highly recommended to stay till afternoon to get a bit of the setting afternoon sun.

title: Winter is Probably not a Good Season to Visit this
text: With no flowers and some of the statues being covered up, winter is not a good time to visit this place. However, for fans of the movie "The Sound of Music", it is still a place worth taking a quick walk if time permit since this is one of the movie locations.

title: Great Location, Comfortable Room and Excellent Service
text:
Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The location was great as it was located in the quieter part of the city yet within walkable distance to the key sights as well as to the train and bus stations.

The room was pretty spacious, very clean and comfortable with all the required amenities. Sleep quality was excellent.

Service was excellent too with the hotel staff always ready to help with location enquires and recommendations.

title: Very Nice
text: Came here for hot chocolate as well as the apple strudel. The hot chocolate was just ordinary but the apple strudel was delicious. Service was great too. Recommended.

title: Very Well Organised Tours
text: Did 2 tours with the Company and both were very well organised and well paced, with knowledgeable guides. Tour prices were reasonable too. Highly recommended.

title: One of My Favourite Old Town in Europe
text:
The 1st time I visited Salzburg was several years back as a day trip from Munich by train. I immediately fell in love with this old town but regretted not having enough time. Hence, decided to visit Salzburg again and this time around stayed a few nights so as to explore more of the absolutely beautiful Old Town.

Visiting during winter definitely has its advantage as there were lesser crowd. Loved how well the old town has been preserved, with the many wonderful architecture, shops, cafes and restaurants. A definite must visit when in Austria.

title: Worth Visiting
text: This church is located in a quieter spot as compared to Salzburg cathedral and hence was less busy. Although not as grand as Salzburg Cathedral but still worth a visit when in the old town.

title: Love Locks and Nice Views
text: Loved coming here at night for the nice views on both sides of the bridge, especially with the lights reflected in the waters. Another feature of this bridge was the many love locks on this footbridge. Definitely a great photo spot.

title: Abbey in The Sound of Music Movie!!
text: This is a definite must see for Sound of Music fans. The Abbey was really quiet and the views along the way as well as at the Abbey were great.

title: Beautiful setting
text: This can be visited both during the day and at night. Loved the beautiful architecture along the river Bank.

title: Good Photo Stop
text: This is a pretty big sculpture and is really unique and hence you can't miss it. A really good photo stop.

title: Funicular to the Fortress
text: Took this funicular up the fortress. It is pretty fast and can accommodate quite a number of people.

title: The Sound of Music Pavillion
text: Came here as part of the Sound of Music tour as this is where the Pavillion from the Sound of Music was placed. Definitely another photo stop for movie fans.

title: Nice Lake
text: The walk to the lake from the town centre was nice with paths lined with trees. It was nice to visit the lake in winter where there's not much people.

title: Pink Flamingos
text: Took a boat ride around this nature reserve and the many pink flamingos in this reserve was definitely the key attraction. Learnt a lot from the guide on why they are so pink and it was from the food they were eating. There were other birdlife in the park too. As we can't really get too close to the birds, it will be a good idea to have a zoom camera in order to take close up shots of the lovely flamingos.

title: Place for a Short Stroll through the Mangrove and a dip
text: Took a boat ride to this little spot which has lots of fishes and also a chance for a dip for those who are keen. There's also a footpath where you can take a stroll through the Mangrove and spot some birds too.

title: Mayan Ruins in the Jungle
text: This is a beautiful Mayan site with all the trees which gave this site a mystic feel. Loved walking through the forest, climbing up the ruins and watching the birds building their nests. The only downside was that it can get really humid and hence sweat a lot.

title: Visit only if time permits
text: It was a pretty sight with the lake as the backdrop but the church itself is pretty simple and nothing special. Hence, visit only if time permits.

title: Worth Hiking
text: It was a pretty easy hike up the paved path which took approx. 15 mins. Not much water during winter though but nice views over the late and town.

title: Skulls
text: This is perhaps one of the key attractions at Hallstatt. For a nominal entrance fee, you will be able to see skulls in this pretty small room and you will be given an sheet of information when you pay the entrance fee. However, you are required to return the sheet. Worth a visit and wouldn't take >20 mins.

title: One of the Most Beautiful European Town
text: Came here once during spring and decided to visit again during winter and was lucky to have clear weather. The place is like a piece out of fairytale. Although it's much quieter during the winter, it's still advisable to visit earlier during the day.

title: Nice Park to Chill
text: This is a small park close to the Dom and was a great place to just take a sit and chill and enjoy the fresh air in the morning.

title: Beautiful Church
text: This is a pretty big church and is a must visit when in Augsburg. It has lovely Stained glasses as well as altar.
place: Cathedral of St. Maria (Dom St. Maria)

title: Large Square
text: This is the main square of Augsburg and is also where the city hall is located. The unique part about this big square is the yin and young sign on the floor. Interesting.

title: Local Culture
text: Happened to visit Ulm on a Wednesday and hence had the opportunity to visit the local market which was just in front of the tallest Church in the world. Loved the colourful flowers and fruits.

title: Leaning Tower
text: This was a well preserved tower which is linked to the city wall. Easy to spot and it is visibly leaning backwards especially when viewed together with the buildings around it. Worth a photo stop.

title: Leisurely Stroll
text: Was lucky with the weather when I visited during winter. This was a lovely place for a leisurely as it offers an elevated view of the river on 1 side and the traditional buildings on the other. Great photo opportunities too.

title: Frescoes and Astronomical Clock
text: This is the town hall of Ulm and was eye catching due to its beautiful frescoes and the astronomical clock. The building had its history dated back to the 14th century and is definitely worth a stop when in Ulm.

title: Unique
text: This is worth a quick photo stop when in Ulm. It is a traditional building dated back to the 16th century which is now a hotel. It is known as the Leaning House as it is tilting. Unique.

title: Lovely Houses along the canals
text: It was really enjoyable to walk along the canals and admire the traditional houses. Really quaint and beautiful with many photo opportunities. Not to be missed with in Ulm.

title: Tallest Church in the World
text: This is a must visit when in Ulm. Beautiful architecture and due to its height, you can't really miss it. Didn't climb up the church but loved how the colours from the stained glasses get reflected on the columns of the church. Simply beautiful.

title: Beautiful Lake
text: Visited during winter and was blessed with a clear sunny day. Took a boat ride on this beautiful lake and loved the reflections of the mountain and the town in the waters. Best to visit in the morning.

title: Excellent Thick Hot Chocolate
text: Chanced by this little cafe and ordered a cake, a donut and a cup of hot chocolate. The hot chocolate was deliciously thick and so not too sweet. A great choice on a cold winter's day.

title: Nice Statue
text: This is a great tribute to the author and a great photo stop. It was interesting that characters from the author's famous works were also presented on the sculpture.

title: Interesting Sculpture
text: This is located along the hill below the castle and is based on the main character from the fairy tale Seven Raven. Worth a quick photo stop.

title: Just a Photo Stop
text: This is located in front of the Michael's Gate and shows the distance to other major cities in the rest of the world. Just a quick photo stop.

title: Great Photo Stop
text: Also known as the peace fountain, this is located just opposite the Presidential Palace and is a great place for a quick photo stop with the palace in the background.

title: Historical
text: This is the only preserved gate in the old town, flanked by buildings with some shops and restaurants. Great spot for photos and taking a break from all the walking.

title: Average
text: Came here for lunch and ordered a pork rib. The taste was just average. Service wise was alright and waiting time acceptable. There are better options in the city.

title: Nice Sleepy Little Town
text: Visited this little town on the way to Melk Abbey. Very quiet and sleepy during winter but it was nice to take a stroll around town and admire the architecture there.

title: Lovely Church
text: Was walking around the neighbourhood and chanced upon this church in the quiet neighbourhood. It has nice interior furnishing and is worth a visit when in the area.

title: Ordinary Bridge, Nice Views
text: This is a pretty ordinary Bridge over over the river which is meant for vehicles as well as pedestrians. But the views of the buildings along are banks of the river is beautiful especially at night. Recommended to take a stroll on the bridge at night.

title: Ideal Spot for Photos
text: This footbridge is a ideal spot for taking photos of the beautiful sight on both side of the bridge. Loved how the buildings were reflected on the water.

title: Nice footbridge
text: This footbridge stood out amongst the other bridges due to its colour and design. The views on both side of the bridge are nice as well. Great spot for photos.

title: Great Location
text: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The location was great as it was really close to the main train station. The room was really clean and comfortable with decent size. Service and breakfast were great too.

title: Beautiful Architecture
text: Visited during winter which was much quieter. The guided tour was great. My personal favourite was the beautiful baroque style library. A must see.

title: Nice but not the Prettiest
text: The old town was nice and really enjoyable to walk around during winter when there was lesser crowded. Its pretty but not the prettiest town in Europe. A day trip from Vienna will be sufficient.

title: Nothing Special
text: This is the main square in the old town. Pretty small with some historical buildings but not as impressive as compared to other main squares in other European old towns.

title: Worth the Walk
text: Didn't visit the insert of the castle but the walk up the castle was really pleasant and the views of the town from the castle was great. Recommended.

title: Delicious Chicken Schnitzel
text: The restaurant is centrally located and near to both the church and the town hall. Service was great, price was reasonable and the chicken Schnitzel was delicious.

title: Red Gate
text: This is a well preserved tower gate which forms part of the city wall. Not the best beautiful one but can visit if time permits.

title: Nice Park by the lake
text: This is a nice little park by the lake. Great for just sitting down to people watch or just take a stroll.

title: Just by the lake area
text: Passed by the lake lawn on the way to the lake. Popular with the locals as well as saw people jogging or taking a stroll on the lawn.

title: Worth a Visit
text: This unique building used to be a medieval castle and also a prison but has since been converted to a museum. Worth visiting since it wasn't that expensive.

title: Nice little bridge
text: This is a little bridge facing the lake and the mountain. Really great for a photo stop on the bridge as also with the bridge as a backdrop.

title: Beautiful
text: Was lucky with the weather on the day of the visit. The water was clear and so was the sky and hence has really nice reflections on the lake. It was great to take a stroll along the lake.

title: Nice Gothic Church
text: This was a nice Gothic church worth visiting. It is not very big and hence will not take more than 30 mins to visit.

title: Nice Stroll
text: Took a nice stroll uphill to see the roman ruin. Went early in the morning before the shops and restaurants open and hence not many people around. Great for photos.

title: Visit if Time Permits
text: This is located up a hill and has pretty nice views but other than that nothing special. Just another roman ruin. Visit if time permits.
place: Amphitheater of the Three Gauls (Amphitheatre des Trois Gaules)

title: Interesting Place
text: Came here as part of a walking tour and understand that this was where the local artists/designers were. Interesting but nothing special. Visit only if time permits.

title: Good for a photo stop
text: This is not a big square but it is surrounded by some historical buildings and has a really beautiful fountain right in the centre. Great for a photo stop.

title: Beautiful but turned off during winter
text: Visited this fountain both during the day and at night. It was beautifully sculpted but too bad there's no water during winter.

title: Just an Average Huge Square
text: Chanced by this big square as was attracted by the lights from the ferries wheel. Nothinh spectacular when compared to other squares in the city.

title: Murals with Historical Figure
text: This was another nice piece of art work in Lyon and it featured real historical figures. The building is close to the river. Worth a photo stop.

title: Just Average
text: These are not the main tourist attractions but are some old buildings which formed part of the city and these are in the hidden alleys. Nothing that special. Visit only if there's time.

title: Indoor Market
text: This indoor market is a must visit when in Lyon. There were lots of local produce in this market. A great place to understand the local food culture.
place: Les Halles de Lyon Paul Bocuse

title: Great for a Walk
text: Loved the historical buildings in the old town. Great for a walk with lots of photo opportunities. There were lots of restaurants too.

title: Decent Location and Service
text: This is a pretty small hotel in a pretty decent location but not that near the main train station. There are some restaurants and cafes around and the key sights though not near are within comfortable walking distance. Size of room was still decent for a solo traveller and service was ok. Nothing spectacular but still acceptable.

title: Indoor Market
text: This is an indoor market with quite a number of stalls selling food. Great place for a quick bite. There are also restrooms here but will need to queue up.

title: One of the oldest building
text: This is one of the oldest building in Colmar, built in the 16th century. Not to be missed and great for a quick photo stop.

title: Absolutely Charming
text: Visited Colmar as a day trip from Strasbourg. The old town was really charming and was like a piece out of the fairy tale with the many colourful buildings. A definite must visit.

title: Nice Fast Food
text: Came here for a quick bite. Price was reasonable and service was good. The chicken fingers tasted great too.

title: Clean and centrally located
text: This train station is centrally located and has a unique and modern architecture. It is clean and has some cafes in there, with trains bringing one to other parts of France.

title: Towers and bridges
text: These are a set of towers and bridges in the older part of strasbourg and are amongst the key attractions in town. In order to capture the bridges and towers in 1 pic, best to go to Barrage Vauban.

title: Historical town of Strasbourg
text: This is the historical centre of strasbourg with lots of timber buildings, restaurants and also churches. Great place for photos and sight seeing.

title: Quaint and Beautiful
text: Visited this place twice. Once on a foggy day and another time on a clearer day. It was a really quaint and beautiful place with a lot of charm and character. Really enjoyed walking around this part of strasbourg. Not to be missed.

title: Beautiful Cathedral
text: This is a must visit when in Strasbourg as it is absolutely beautiful both on the outside as well as within.

title: Excellent Location
text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and everything was perfect. Location was great as it was just mins walk to the main train station and also near the key attractions. It was also near restaurants and shops too. The room was spacious, clean and cosy and breakfast spread was good. Service was great too. Highly recommended.

title: Delicious!
text: Came here for dinner and ordered a pork dish which was reasonably priced and really delicious. Service was great too.

title: Lovely Stained Glass
text: Recommended to visit this cathedral if time permits as has beautiful architecture as well as stained glass. Not a very big cathedral so will not take >30 mins to visit.

title: Great Views of the City
text: This is a must do when visiting the Basilica. It has really great views over the city. Nice to take a slow stroll up and down the hill on a day with great weather. Highly recommended.

title: A Must Visit
text: You can't say you have visited if you have not visited this Basilica. It is beautifully built and furnished and has really great views of the city as well. A must visit when in Lyon.

title: Worth a visit
text: This place is up a hill but worth visiting as there are really nice murals here. A great photo stop. Recommended.

title: Nice Square
text: This is a nice square with a number of beautiful buildings as well as a beautifully sculpted fountain. It was also the meeting point for walking tours. Recommended to visit at night as well.

title: Outdoor Market
text: This outdoor market was just by the river and has quite a number of stalls selling local crafts and produce. A definite must visit.

title: Charming Old Town
text: Really loved this beautiful old town and especially the reflection of it in the waters on a clear blue day. It was a great place to take a stroll and admire the architecture. There were also lots of restaurants in the old town.

title: Was Closed
text: The walk up to the castle from the old town was pretty nice but it was unfortunately closed when I went. Definitely worth visiting if given the chance again.

title: Nice views on the bridge
text: This is a must visit for a free and nice view over part of strasbourg, especially on a clear day. Great place for photos.

title: Main Shopping belt
text: This is the main Shopping belt of Strasbourg and also where the X'mas Market was held. There was a small market when I visited. Had an enjoyable short visit.

title: Nice Little Square
text: This is a nice little square near to the Cathedral and there is also a statue of Guten in the square and hence can't be missed. Nice for a short visit. There were also restaurants around the square.

title: Excellent Introduction to the City
text: Went on a free tour with Happy and it was well organised and well paced. The guide was informative and humorous and it was a great introduction to the Strasbourg. Recommended.

title: Beautiful
text: This is a must see when in Colmar. Loved the colourful historical buildings and how they were reflected on the waters. Best to visit during a clear blue day.

title: Nice Gothic Church
text: This is a pretty big church and hence can't be missed. Built in Gothic style dated back to some 700 years ago. Great for a quick visit.

title: Beautiful Main Street
text: This is the main street of Colmar and is a definite must visit. Lots of coloured timber buildings and great for photos.

title: Delicious Indonesian Cuisine
text: Visited the outlet at Far East Plaza. Prices are reasonable and the service good and efficient. The food tasted authentic and delicious. Recommended.

title: Great Views from the top
text: You can't miss this tower as you can see it clearly due to its colours. The views of the town was great from the top of the tower.

title: Reasonably Priced Nice Food
text: Came here for lunch. Price was reasonable, service was good and the portion was general. Tasted good too. Recommended.

title: Unique Structure
text: You can't miss this as you go in and out of the historical centre as it is so unique and beautifully built.
